snippet: Hundreds of thousands of Greeks make a living in tourism, and though officials say visits have been steady, economic tumult in the high season has many worried.
abstract: Timing of Greek referendum on European bailout terms coincides with beginning of high tourism season, bulwark of economy; tourism authorities say while few travelers have canceled trips and many visitors say their trips have not been disrupted, future bookings are slipping; fear is that financial crisis will affect tourism, which will in turn make crisis worse.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of thousands of Greeks make a living in tourism, and though officials say visits have been steady, economic tumult in the high season has many worried.

headline.main: As Referendum Looms, Greece’s Tourism Industry Holds Its Breath
headline.print_headline: A Nation’s Tourism Industry Holds Its Breath as Voters Weigh Their Choice
